metadata.synopsis: Karlach confronts Gortash after ceremony in WYR.In this dialogue, Karlach is facing the man who sold her to the devil. She hasn't talked to him in 10 years and she's furious for his betrayal. The player can allow Karlach to fight him here, but in most cases they won't.
metadata.how_to_trigger: In BGO with Karlach recruited as a companion goto 28; 60; 209 and approach Gortash. After the ceremony, go to where Gortash is back again and speak with him.

7.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
7.text: Dearest Karlach. I'd busy myself finding Orin if I were you. I'll still be here for any unfinished business, once you've secured your camp.

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: That's it? That's all you have to say to me?

56.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
56.text: Were you hoping for something else? A word of wisdom? A hug?

24.speaker: Karlach
24.text: Thanks to you, I don't hope for things anymore. I just take whatever it is I want. See you soon, motherfucker.

34.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
34.text: This was your doing, wasn't it, Karlach? The destruction of my Steel Watch. Such a petty vengeance.

29.speaker: Karlach
29.text: Those things were evil - just like their papa.

26.speaker: Karlach
26.text: To think I ever worked for you. Proudly, too.

46.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
46.text: It's hard to keep a good woman down, isn't it, Karlach?
46.context: NodeContext: Voice dripping with sarcasm. He doesn't actually respect her, but he feigns it.

59.speaker: Karlach
59.text: I don't know. You managed it for a solid decade.

22.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
22.text: I never meant to harm you, dear, merely to help you realise your vast potential.

18.speaker: Karlach
18.text: You sent me to the Hells. You let Zariel take my heart. As though any of it was yours to give away.

9.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
9.text: The greater good, Karlach. Something I wouldn't expect you to understand.

58.speaker: Karlach
58.text: You feel no regret, do you. All right. How about fear then?

61.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
61.text: You can't hurt me. You need me. Whether you and your friend realise it or not.

11.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
11.text: Oh, you do quite misunderstand. I've already made a deal with your companion. We need each other.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Orin's dead, and the Steel Watch is destroyed. I don't think we need much else from you, Gortash.

64.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
64.text: How wrong you are. You have no clue how to control the elder brain. It will destroy the Sword Coast, yourself included. Together, we can tame it.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Easy, Karlach; we won't make it far against the Steel Watch.

16.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
16.text: Listen to reason, for once in your life. I'm sorry you feel wronged about how things ended between us, but that was ten years ago. We must look to the future.

21.speaker: Karlach
21.text: There will come a time, sooner than you think, when death comes knocking on your door. You'll swing that door open, and you'll cower before what you see, and you'll beg, 'Please, Karlach. Spare me.'

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Let's not be too hasty. We ought to respect our alliance with Gortash.

0.speaker: Karlach
0.text: The man doesn't know the meaning of the word respect. He'll double cross us at the first opportunity.

51.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
51.text: You're wrong, Karlach. I'm sorry you're still sore about how things ended between us, but that was ten years ago. We must look to the future.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: No; I never agreed to ally with him.

10.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
10.text: Whether or not you accepted my generous offer, the fact stands that you cannot control the elder brain without my expertise.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: Never mind that, Gortash; we've heard all we need from the likes of you.

5.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
5.text: You ought to reconsider. Divided, the elder brain will create an illithid army, yourself included in its ranks. Together, we can tame it.

23.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
23.text: I'm sorry you feel wronged by how things ended between us all those years ago. But now, we must look to the future.

20.speaker: Karlach
20.text: You make it sound like we were lovers. Or friends. But that wasn't it.

57.speaker: Karlach
57.text: I trusted you. I respected you. It was my job to protect you, and that's what I did.

12.speaker: Karlach
12.text: I was so young. I didn't recognise evil when I saw it.

66.speaker: Karlach
66.text: When you turned on me, I was too dumbstruck to realise what was happening. No way he'd hurt me, I thought.

44.speaker: Karlach
44.text: You betrayed me for reasons I still don't quite understand. But I suppose evil has no real cause. It just is.

33.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
33.text: You utter brat. You're going to burn this place down!

47.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
47.text: No. You have to stop her. Do it! Now!

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Karlach, stop this. You're burning too hot.

1.speaker: Karlach
1.text: Then run while you still can.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Get out of here while you can, Gortash.

55.speaker: Karlach
55.text: You can't escape me. Wherever you go, I'll find you. Wherever you run, there I'll be.

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: Don't lecture me about goodness. You don't know the first thing about it.

42.speaker: Karlach
42.text: But I do. I give a shit. I don't hurt the people I love. And I keep my promises, too.

49.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
49.text: Ah - a familiar face, and a fondly-remembered one indeed. How have you been, Karlach?

3.speaker: Karlach
3.context: NodeContext: Enuniciating each word with import.

54.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
54.text: You're agitated. I'd keep an eye on that. My Steel Watch are sensitive to anything they perceive as a threat.

45.speaker: Karlach
45.text: Very clever, fabricating people to do your fighting for you. But they won't be able to protect you forever, Gortash.
